root_causes: The computed A4x1_sum only includes A4x1_1 to A4x1_5 and does not include the 'Other' multi option variable (assumed A4x1_98). As a result, respondents who selected only the Other option will be treated as having selected none and will be flagged incorrectly by the DK/none-selected checks.

The script assumes the open-end text variable is named A4x1_98_other; if the actual OE field has a different name the OE presence/length check will miss/incorrectly flag cases. (This is a logical dependency on variable naming.)
instructions: Include the Other option variable in the selection sum so the 'at least one item selected' check counts Other. For example: compute A4x1_sum = sum(A4x1_1 to A4x1_5, A4x1_98).
Validate the Other option variable in the initial 0/1 validity loop (or extend the DO REPEAT) so A4x1_98 is checked for non-missing and coded 0/1 just like the other multi items.
Confirm the actual name of the open-end text variable associated with the Other option. If it is not A4x1_98_other, replace A4x1_98_other in the OE validation with the correct variable name.
Optionally add a check that A4DKx1 contains only expected codes (e.g., 0/1 or 1 for DK) before using it in the DK logic to avoid false positives from unexpected DK values.

root_causes: selcount is calculated as sum(A4x1_1 to A4x1_5) which sums raw item values — this will treat special codes (97/98/99) as large numeric contributions and will not correctly count only selected items (value=1).
Option-level Other validation is incorrect: the script sets an error flag unconditionally when A4x1_5 = 1 instead of validating the corresponding OE text variable for presence and minimum length.

Question-level OE handling is incorrect: the placeholder code sets an error whenever any selection exists (selcount > 0) instead of validating the specific question-level OE variable's presence/length only when appropriate.

CheckDK3D behavior (mutual exclusivity and DK handling) is not fully implemented — only used in the selection-minimum check; there is no enforcement that DK (A4DKx1) is exclusive (i.e., if DK = 1 then other items must be not selected).
OE variable names are not referenced (no actual OE variable like A4x1_5_OE or A4x1_OE is validated); the script uses placeholders/comments rather than concrete OE checks.
instructions: Compute selcount to count only items explicitly selected (value = 1). For example: compute selcount = (A4x1_1 = 1) + (A4x1_2 = 1) + (A4x1_3 = 1) + (A4x1_4 = 1) + (A4x1_5 = 1). This ensures special codes (97/98/99) do not inflate the selection count.

Implement option-level OE validation using the actual OE variable name (confirm variable name in the dataset, e.g., A4x1_5_OE). Example logic: if (A4x1_5 = 1) and (missing(A4x1_5_OE) or strlen(rtrim(ltrim(A4x1_5_OE))) < 5) then flag = max(flag,4). Replace strlen/rtrim/ltrim with appropriate SPSS string functions if needed.

Implement question-level OE validation only when the multi has any selection (selcount > 0) and only against the correct question-level OE variable (if one exists, e.g., A4x1_OE). Example: if (selcount > 0) and (missing(A4x1_OE) or strlen(strip(A4x1_OE)) < 5) flag = max(flag,4).

Enforce CheckDK3D semantics fully: if A4DKx1 = 1 then ensure all A4x1_1..A4x1_5 are not selected (i.e., equal to 0 or missing/special codes as appropriate). Conversely, if any A4x1_* = 1 then A4DKx1 should not be 1. Add explicit checks and flag errors accordingly.
Keep the per-item validity check for allowed codes (0,1,97,98,99) but ensure that selcount and subsequent logic treat 97/98/99 as special codes (not selections).

Replace placeholder comments with concrete validations referencing the actual OE variable names from the data dictionary so CheckMultiOpenD1() and CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(...) behaviors are implemented in SPSS code.
